question: Question_06_(b)
statement:
This question requires little or no calculations.

If $A=C^{-1}BC$, where \emph{C} is an invertible matrix, and det
\emph{B}=12, det \emph{C}=-3. Calculate det \emph{A}.
sols:
By the equation $A = C^{-1}BC$, we can see that $A,B$ are similar
matrices.

One of the properties of similar matrices is that their determinants are
equal. Hence,

\begin{align*}{\color{blue}\operatorname{Det}(A) = \operatorname{Det}(B) =12}\end{align*}
